meanings.definition: A unit of measure equal to one third of a pipe of wine.
meanings.sent1: The winemaker poured a tierce of wine into the barrel.
meanings.sent2: The bartender measured out a tierce of wine for the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The tierce of wine decided to take a nap in the barrel.
meanings.sent4: The tierce of wine stood out in the cellar like a jewel.
meanings.sent5: The tierce of wine sparkled in the dim light, tempting all who passed by.

meanings.definition: A sequence of three playing cards of the same suit.
meanings.sent1: She laid down a tierce of hearts in the card game.
meanings.sent2: The tierce of spades completed his winning hand.
meanings.sent3: The tierce of diamonds danced across the table in a game of poker.
meanings.sent4: His tierce of clubs trumped all other players' hands.
meanings.sent5: The tierce of hearts fluttered like butterflies as it was revealed.

meanings.definition: A position in fencing with the sword hand held at waist level.
meanings.sent1: The fencer confidently took the tierce stance before the match.
meanings.sent2: In the tierce position, he awaited his opponent's move.
meanings.sent3: The tierce stance made the fencer feel like a swashbuckling hero.
meanings.sent4: His tierce guard was impenetrable, like a fortress of steel.
meanings.sent5: The tierce position felt like a powerful stance ready for battle.
